description: Iran frees US Navy veteran. Iran's Foreign Ministry has confirmed that the Islamic Republic has freed US Navy veteran Michael White, who was kept in detention in Iran for more than two years on vague charges. Radio Iran quoted the ministry's spokesman, Abbas Mousavi, as saying that Mr White was released having obtained "the consent of the plaintiffs" and is being...
text:
By BBC Monitoring

(Please note that Iranian newspapers do not publish on Fridays and Channel One
(IRTV1) does not air its morning news bulletin.) Iran frees US Navy veteran

Iran's Foreign Ministry has confirmed that the Islamic Republic has freed US
Navy veteran Michael White, who was kept in detention in Iran for more than
two years on vague charges.

Radio Iran (VIRI) quoted the ministry's spokesman, Abbas Mousavi, as saying
that Mr White was released having obtained "the consent of the plaintiffs" and
is being granted "Islamic clemency".

Mousavi also confirmed the release of Iranian-American dual national Majid
Taheri, who the radio said was imprisoned in the United States for "false
reasons".

Rolling news channel IRINN reported that Foreign Minister Javad Zarif
confirmed the prisoner exchange between Tehran and Washington.

"Pleased that Dr Majid Taheri and Mr White will soon be joining their
families. Prof Sirous Asgari was happily reunited with his family on Weds.
This can happen for all prisoners. No need for cherry picking. Iranian
hostages held in - and on behalf of - the US should come home," Zarif tweeted
last night. Asgari, who was acquitted of stealing trade secrets in violation
of US sanctions against Iran last November, arrived in Iran early on 3 June.
Reports of Iranian ship sinking

Reports are coming in that an Iranian ship called the Behbahan sank in the
Khor Abdullah Shipping Channel between Iraq and Kuwait last night.

Hardline Tasnim news agency quoted Iraqi politician Kadhim Finjan al Hammami
telling local website Shafaaq News that four crew members had been rescued but
five others were still missing. Entekhab news website said the reason behind
the incident was not known. Floyd protests in US

International-facing English-language Press TV continues to report extensively
on the anti-police brutality protests across the US that were sparked by the
death of African-American citizen George Floyd at the hands of the Minneapolis
police.

The channel today showed footage of a memorial ceremony that was held in
Minneapolis for Floyd.

Domestic news channel IRINN also covered the story.

CORONAVIRUS

To read the best of our Covid-19 coverage please click here. To set up
thematic feeds of our content on the pandemic, please see here for details.
Confirmed cases rising

The number of confirmed cases of Covid-19 coronavirus infection has been on
the rise in the country, reaching 3,574 cases over 24 hours, VIRI reported.

The channel quoted member of the Combating Coronavirus HQ, Masoud Younesian,
as saying that the plans to control the pandemic need to be revised. He
advised people to take health protocols more seriously.

See yesterday's roundup: Covid-19 Roundup: Iran 4 June 2020

See also: Coronavirus: Iran fears second wave after surge in cases Social buzz

After another fire was reported in Iran, this time in the area surrounding
Tehran's Chitgar Lake, pro-establishment users have described the numerous
occurrences of such incidents across the country as "suspicious".

Wildfires have been raging across a number of western provinces for the past
week, causing extensive damage to the local flora and fauna.

One hardline user blamed the exiled opposition group MKO for the fires.

Elsewhere, some users shared videos of a local woman trying to put out a
bushfire in Andika, Khuzestan Province, and lamented the state media's failure
to report such efforts. Coming up

Friday prayers services will be held in the southern Iranian city of Shiraz
after a more than three-month break forced by the Covid-19 pandemic, Tasnim
has reported. See also:

Weekly quotes package from Iranian officials for 29 May-4 June

Source: BBC Monitoring 5 June 20

title: BBCM Iran Watchlist for 5 June
html:
By BBC Monitoring

(Please note that Iranian newspapers do not publish on Fridays and Channel One (IRTV1) does not air its morning news bulletin.) Iran frees US Navy veteran

Iran's Foreign Ministry has confirmed that the Islamic Republic has freed US Navy veteran Michael White, who was kept in detention in Iran for more than two years on vague charges.

Radio Iran (VIRI) quoted the ministry's spokesman, Abbas Mousavi, as saying that Mr White was released having obtained "the consent of the plaintiffs" and is being granted "Islamic clemency".

Mousavi also confirmed the release of Iranian-American dual national Majid Taheri, who the radio said was imprisoned in the United States for "false reasons".

Rolling news channel IRINN reported that Foreign Minister Javad Zarif confirmed the prisoner exchange between Tehran and Washington.

"Pleased that Dr Majid Taheri and Mr White will soon be joining their families. Prof Sirous Asgari was happily reunited with his family on Weds. This can happen for all prisoners. No need for cherry picking. Iranian hostages held in - and on behalf of - the US should come home," Zarif tweeted last night. Asgari, who was acquitted of stealing trade secrets in violation of US sanctions against Iran last November, arrived in Iran early on 3 June. Reports of Iranian ship sinking

Reports are coming in that an Iranian ship called the Behbahan sank in the Khor Abdullah Shipping Channel between Iraq and Kuwait last night.

Hardline Tasnim news agency quoted Iraqi politician Kadhim Finjan al Hammami telling local website Shafaaq News that four crew members had been rescued but five others were still missing. Entekhab news website said the reason behind the incident was not known. Floyd protests in US

International-facing English-language Press TV continues to report extensively on the anti-police brutality protests across the US that were sparked by the death of African-American citizen George Floyd at the hands of the Minneapolis police.

The channel today showed footage of a memorial ceremony that was held in Minneapolis for Floyd.

Domestic news channel IRINN also covered the story.

CORONAVIRUS

To read the best of our Covid-19 coverage please click here. To set up thematic feeds of our content on the pandemic, please see here for details. Confirmed cases rising

The number of confirmed cases of Covid-19 coronavirus infection has been on the rise in the country, reaching 3,574 cases over 24 hours, VIRI reported.

The channel quoted member of the Combating Coronavirus HQ, Masoud Younesian, as saying that the plans to control the pandemic need to be revised. He advised people to take health protocols more seriously.

See yesterday's roundup: Covid-19 Roundup: Iran 4 June 2020

See also: Coronavirus: Iran fears second wave after surge in cases Social buzz

After another fire was reported in Iran, this time in the area surrounding Tehran's Chitgar Lake, pro-establishment users have described the numerous occurrences of such incidents across the country as "suspicious".

Wildfires have been raging across a number of western provinces for the past week, causing extensive damage to the local flora and fauna.

One hardline user blamed the exiled opposition group MKO for the fires.

Elsewhere, some users shared videos of a local woman trying to put out a bushfire in Andika, Khuzestan Province, and lamented the state media's failure to report such efforts. Coming up
